data.name: Find the Base
data.description:
We've found some old papers belonging to the late mathematician Dr Baseless

Dr Baseless was known to work with number systems of different bases, and therefore the team are having some difficulty understanding his work.

You've been given a set of equations, and we need to find out what base each equation is written in.

Luckily, we know that Dr Baseless's arithmetic was flawless, so each equation is known to be correct
Additionally, we know that Dr Baseless never used a base greater than 20

Each equation is given in a string in the form of either:
```
x+y=z
x/y=z
x-y=z
x*y=z
```
All of the numbers will be integers, and all divisions will divide exactly

The characters used to represent digits will be the numbers 0-9 and the letters A-J

For each equation, you must find out in what base the equation holds true

__Example__

The string '11-2=2' is in base 3 because this equation is the base 3 form of 4-2=2, so your program should return 3
